alert.note: Alert for Adair (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 6:21PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Washington and central Adair Counties through 715 PM CDT... At 621 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 5 miles west of Watts, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Stilwell... Lincoln... Westville... Watts... Adair State Park... Christie... Devils Den State Park... Strickler... Cincinnati... Maryetta... Baron... Ballard... Clyde... Canehill... Odell... Summers... Morrow... This includes Interstate 49 near mile marker 41. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northwestern Arkansas...and northeastern Oklahoma.
